alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 23 at 11:26AM MST until March 23 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The Havasu Creek basin in... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 700 PM MST Thursday /800 PM MDT Thursday/. * At 1117 AM MST /1217 PM MDT/, river gauges continued to show rises along Cataract Creek upstream of the Havasu Creek basin. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Upstream heavy rain and snowmelt producing flash flooding in and around the Havasu Creek basin. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Havasu Creek basin. These rises are higher than those that occurred during the last week. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Havasupai Reservation and Supai. This includes the following swimming holes... All swimming holes on Havasu Creek near Supai. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Havasu Creek and Heather Wash. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Residents, campers, and hikers should hustle to higher ground immediately! Stay away from creeks and washes! Travel throughout Supai Village will be limited. Homes...property... and roadways near Havasu Creek in Supai Village will be flooded. Much of Supai Campground will likely be inundated.
